interface.name: zen_display_system
interface.description: A singleton global object through which clients can manage zen's display system, which manages how the desktop environment is presented to the user. For example, it can be presented in VR.

entry.name: no_immersive_device
entry.summary: No device found for immersive display

entry.name: screen
entry.summary: display desktop environment with physical screens

entry.name: immersive
entry.summary: display desktop environment with immersive display

request.name: switch_type
request.description: Request a server to switch display system type.

event.name: applied
event.description: Notification that a new display system type has been applied. When a client binds to zen_displa_system, creating clien-side handle, the server must send this event immediately to the handle.

event.name: warning
event.description: The warning event is sent out when a non-fatal error has occurred. The message is a brief description of the error, for (debugging) convenience.

request.name: release
request.description: Using this request, a client can tell the server that the client is not going to use the zen_display_system anymore.
